habitat_description: The San Marcos salamander is described to occur in outflows of San Marcos Springs in the city of San Marcos, Hays County, Texas (Bishop 1941; Lannoo 2005). These springs have been heavily modified by humans to construct a small lake. More recently, San Marcos salamanders occupy this lake and upstream the San Marcos River in springs at elevations of 174 meters (Green et al. 2013). As adults, this species is completely aquatic and is found in growths of blue algae (Lyngbya sp.), in gravel substrate, under rocks, and in the water column at water depths more than a meter.
